Message.Title: Problem with Project Grid
Message.Msg: Yes, latency for industry has improved, but is it enough ? During Jens presentation, grid seems to be working fine when playing graphics intensive games. Problem is during presentations, the grid servers is placed very near the player and the consoles. Hence low latency. But in real life, the servers will be far. Once this can be solved convincingly, Nvidia will be the Netflix. Else, its all hyped again.

Topic.Title: Problem with Project Grid

Message.Msg: If this post doesn't make it clear how stupid you are to everyone, including the gang of bashers keeping you company this weekend, then nothing will . . how old are you anyways? Man, you are dumb.

Topic.Title: Problem with Project Grid

Message.Msg: Huh? Who's the stupid one again? Why u just rant rant rant crying father crying mother .....with zero arguments based on facts. I named facts during my arguments. I wish Nvidia really solved latency problems totally, however its really difficult. U know why? In urban cities there are lots of buildings. And how can data transmit so fast through it? Do u surf internet dude? Currently loading pages already has some delays at times, playing games? The answer is common sense. Look, another common sensical answer to Nvidia $1b spending is obvious. U think if their business is growing well, they will give out this $1b? They have been so reluctant to do this. Once they announced the leaving of tegra chief, followed by nil consoles win, then weak tegra 4, then a sudden project shield, and finally this $1b, I know it is in trouble. Trying to play magiC. Keep coming out with new tricks.

Topic.Title: Problem with Project Grid

Message.Msg: Yes latency will be a priority for the gaming aspects of Grid, but not for the Grid VCA or Grid enabled enterprise servers. I am curious as to how big of a latency factor you are expecting here, specially since the only data that will be transmitted over the internet will be video basically just live streaming a 1080p video. The real issue would be on the server side of things, making sure that the graphics card can render and toss the next frame back quickly enough, which I think Grid clearly accomplished

Topic.Title: Problem with Project Grid

Message.Msg: Aside from being a total ignoramus, chrissy needs to address his severe latency problem. Perhaps he and the other bash-bots here can get a group discount for some professional help they obviously need?

Topic.Title: Problem with Project Grid

Message.Msg: I dun proclaim to know. The problem with graphics intensive games are such that I its not just a video steaming. In video streaming, its a one way street data transfers. In gaming, its server to gamer, gamer to server and back to gamer. Not gonna be easy. Heard of apps not running on apps store anymore, but on html pages running on internet? This sounds like great idea as developers can skip paying Apple or Google for apps. Ain't taking off big time cos webpages takes time to load. Well, at least irkbik talks fact and debate. Not like the useless Roundhouse & chitownbarber, just like mad dog barking senselessly with no facts, no substance. At least ibexx knows how to talk facts. Or at least have class to ignore negative comments and bashers. Show some class like ibexx, stop being like mad dog, roundhouse and chitownbarber!!

Message.Title: How will Nvidia replace the one customer accounting for 60% of Tegra 3 sales?
Message.Msg: Nvidia won't replace Google. Nvidia will NOT find another customer to take 60% of Tegra chips again. When Google took its Nexus business to QCOM the Tegra line was sentenced to a slow death. Other OEMs are asking themselves now, why didn't Google want Tegra 4? Google is a leader and Google is leading the ARM SoC parade to QCOM. imho

Topic.Title: How will Nvidia replace the one customer accounting for 60% of Tegra 3 sales?

Message.Msg: "Other OEMs are asking themselves now, why didn't Google want Tegra 4?" They could be, but they will just sample the chip for themselves. "Nvidia will NOT find another customer to take 60% of Tegra chips again." Very likely, but they could find 3 customers to account for 20% of Tegra chips each, or 4 for 15% etc.

Message.Title: A busy week for earnings, especially the mobile/telco stocks - AAPL, QCOM, BRCM etc on tap
Message.Msg: --Tuesday, 4/23 Apple: Wall Street expects eps $10.07 on $42.5 billion revenues Also reporting: ARM Holdings,, ATT, Broadcom, RFMD --Wednesday, 4/24 Qualcomm, Sprint-Nextel --Thursday, 4/25 Amazon, InterDigital, Cirrus Logic (a major AAPL supplier, already pre-warned), Skyworks Solutions _____ PS: In fact, AAPL's numbers would almost seem irrelevant to its stock price, as Apple's decline is due to its falling behind in innovation - particularly bad for a growth company with high expectations.

Topic.Title: Forbes: Is Apple looking for a replacement for CEO Cook? (Yes....big investors want him out!

Message.Msg: Basically. this can be viewed as an attempted CHECKMATE on Tim Cook. At the earnings cc tomorrow, Apple may be forced to declare one or all of the following to stabilize stock price: -- A special one-time (and hefty) dividend --increased (regular) dividend --accelerated stock buy-back Interesting to see how it will play out....there are really no fast fix for Apple's dilemma as innovation takes time. Tim Cook is a manager, not a leader. That is the peril of a mega-sized, high-profile company who put an operations manager in charge.

Topic.Title: Forbes: Is Apple looking for a replacement for CEO Cook? (Yes....big investors want him out!

Message.Msg: Wouldn't you think the only way Jen would go to Apple is if Nvidia being bought by Apple would be part of the deal?

Topic.Title: Forbes: Is Apple looking for a replacement for CEO Cook? (Yes....big investors want him out!

Message.Msg: Roundhouse, mine may be a minority opinion compared with others on this board, but I will offer it regardless. I think it would be bad news if Jen went to Apple as TC's replacement, even as a related event, Apple acquired NVDA. My long-term understanding is that the ultimate dream of JH/NVIDIA will be to revolutionize the tech world with visual computing. Ideally; they will clearly be aiming at the universal adoption of their GPGPU technologies by all major vendors, OS publishers and HW designers. A lock-in with one company - even Apple - would be in serious conflict with this ideal. Sure, Apple's resources and gigantic marketing presence would be tempting, but I am not sure if an offer did come JH's way (unlikely to begin with) he would definitely say yes. He hasn't struck me as the kind of leader who places $$$ and power above all.

Topic.Title: Forbes: Is Apple looking for a replacement for CEO Cook? (Yes....big investors want him out!

Message.Msg: Although the future looks as promising than ever for Nvidia, but the old phrase of "what have you done lately" comes into play as the Apple board will surly be looking at if they are looking for a replacement? Jobs left enough direction before he died. In the next couple years Jen needs to execute on the vision that he started before he gets any kind of respect from the tech world and Wall street.

Topic.Title: Forbes: Is Apple looking for a replacement for CEO Cook? (Yes....big investors want him out!

Message.Msg: 2 points: 1. Jobs did not leave a playbook that would last for years. According to pundits as well as what Apple has offered in the last 12 months, the script is just about to be played out except for the TV part. Just to make devices thinner and lighter is NOT innovation, nor any of the rumor gimmicky stuff like watch or other wrap-around devices. 2. NVIDIA is a new comer enbarking on a field that has been dominated by Qualcomm for more than 25 years. Anyone claiming NV isn't executing is out of his/her mind - pardon the strong language - I hear many expert reports (linley, for example) saying that it is AMAZING what NV has accomplished in 2 or 3 years. I owned both QC and BRCM years ago, and I knew what snails paces they were crawling along.....and they were the pioneers with no pressure from competition. Anyone having no confidence or respect for NVIDIA should not own the stock. As to WS - they are a fickle bunch. Do you remember that as recent as six months ago that 90% of WS analysts had BUY ratings on AAPL? THOU SHALT NOT INVEST BY WS SELL_SIDE ANALS!

Message.Title: Nvidia must grow fast, Intel cash running out
Message.Msg: I think Intel cash royalties is running out like in 2 years time. Nvidia wasted last 3 years having it shares price dropping. Now market will be more demanding to see good growth for Nvidia since revenue profits and cash in dropping in 2 years. Spending $1 b on buybacks ain't enough. Lat 2 years Nvidia tegra looked so promising. First to launch quad core. But yet, mediatek kicked Nvidia to the curb big time. I recalled posting about mediatek months ago. Permabulls commented that I should wait for tegra 4, that it is a game changer. Bashers disagreed, and said tegra is a waste. I believed in bulls then. Now that tegra 4 is out. Omg, its really a waste. And hearing Jen talked again about the future. Tegra 4i, tegra 5. ! F him man. Enough is enough. Heard of promises from kids? Daddy daddy, I promise my next semester will show better results, teacher teacher I promised to be a good student next time. After many promises, all just listen and lose faith. No longertrust the words. TThat's right, this is what's happening to Nvidia. Jen, he should be an Oscar actor, not CEO.

The watch is a gimmicky item that will appeal to current Apple users, and not something as a must have item. I agree with you that Nvidia has come a long way. Unfortunately Wall street is taking a wait and see posture.
